thread.title: Man clinging to life after shot five times in the Bronx
thread.title_full: Man clinging to life after shot five times in the Bronx

author: JOHN ANNESE
title: Man clinging to life after shot five times in the Bronx
text:
Man clinging to life after shot five times in the Bronx Man clinging to life after shot five times in the Bronx Police investigate the scene of a shooting on E. 181 St. and Valentine Ave. in the Bronx on Sunday. (Gardiner Anderson/for New York Daily News) Police investigate the shooting on Sunday. (Gardiner Anderson/for New York Daily News) Police investigate the scene after a man was shot five times Sunday. (Gardiner Anderson/for New York Daily News) NEW YORK DAILY NEWS Sunday, January 1, 2017, 9:23 PM 
A man is fighting to survive after a gun-toting attacker blasted him five times on a Bronx street corner Sunday night. 
The shooter opened fire by the corner of Valentine Ave. and E. 181st St. in Fordham Heights just after 7:30 p.m., officials said. He struck the 21-year-old victim once in the neck and four times in the chest, police sources said. 
Medics rushed the victim to St. Barnabas Ave. in critical condition, an FDNY spokesman said. 
Police were searching for a black man in a brown coat, wearing grey sweatpants and grey sneakers.
